events.name: click
events.summary: Fired when the device detects a click against the view.
events.description:
There is a subtle difference between singletap and click events.

A singletap event is generated when the user taps the screen briefly without moving their finger. This gesture will also generate a click event.

However, a click event can also be generated when the user touches, moves their finger, and then removes it from the screen.

The click event can also be generated by a trackball click.

If you want to receive and trigger the value of switch, please use the change event instead.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: animated
properties.summary: Determines if there is animation when the switch value changes.
properties.description: Set to true if animation is desired or false for no animation.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Color to use for switch text, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: enabled
properties.summary: Determines whether the switch is enabled.
properties.description:
Be careful not to confused this with the value property, which is used to turn the switch on and off.

Set to true to enable or false to disable the switch.

properties.name: font
properties.summary: Font to use for the switch text.

properties.name: onTintColor
properties.summary: The color used to tint the appearance of the switch when it is turned on.

properties.name: style
properties.summary: Style of the switch.
properties.description: Prior to Release 4.0, you can only specify either a toggle button or checkbox.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.summary: Horizontal text alignment of the switch title.
properties.description: On Android, when the switch style property is set to SWITCH_STYLE_CHECKBOX, this property is only effective if the width property is set to a value greater than the width of the title contents.

properties.name: thumbTintColor
properties.summary: The color used to tint the appearance of the thumb.

properties.name: tintColor
properties.summary: The color used to tint the outline of the switch when it is turned off.
properties.description: This property is a direct correspondant of the tintColor property of UIView on iOS. If no value is specified, the tintColor of the View is inherited from its superview.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Text to display next to the switch, when the checkbox style is in use.
properties.description:
This property is only effective when the style property is set to SWITCH_STYLE_CHECKBOX.

Use the textAlign property to align this text within the switch.

properties.name: titleOff
properties.summary: Text to display on the switch in its "off" state, when the toggle button style is in use.
properties.description:
Set to an empty string to remove title text.

It is typically useful to set the width and/or height properties, to prevent the switch changing size between its on/off state.

properties.name: titleOn
properties.summary: Text to display on the switch in its "on" state, when the toggle button style is in use.
properties.description:
Set to an empty string to remove title text.

It is typically useful to set the width and/or height properties, to prevent the switch changing size between its on/off state.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Indicates whether the switch has been turned on or off by the user. May also be set programmatically.
properties.description:
Set to true to turn on and false to turn off the switch.

On Android, if this property is not defined, the rendered state of the switch is off.

On iOS, be aware that this property must be set when the switch is rendered, otherwise it will not be visible. This is a known issue.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.summary: Vertical alignment for the text field.
